alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Menominee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 8:34PM EDT until April 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Dickinson, Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near McAllister affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Niagara affecting Dickinson, Florence, Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Dickinson and Iron Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Pike River near Amberg affecting Marinette County. Menominee River near Koss affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Menominee River at White Rapids Dam affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Florence, Forest, Dickinson and Iron Counties. Peshtigo River near Porterfield affecting Marinette County. Peshtigo River below Caldron Falls Dam affecting Marinette County. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Niagara. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet, water is covering adjacent parks in both Kingsford and Niagara. River Road in Aurora is covered with water. This stage compares to a flow of 19700 cubic feet per second. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM CDT Monday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.
